intro: Commiphora seyrigi, commonly known as the African myrrh, is a flowering plant in the Burseraceae family. It is native to parts of Africa, particularly Tanzania and Kenya, and thrives in tropical and subtropical climates. The plant produces a resinous sap that has been traditionally used for medicinal and aromatic purposes. Its small, fragrant flowers are typically yellow or greenish-yellow, and it has simple, alternate leaves. Commiphora seyrigi is often found in dry woodlands and savannas, where it plays a role in local ecosystems.
